page.title: 15Attitudes
page.content: As with most people throughout Britain,the residents of this area are concerned about the current problems facing our country today.Problems such as unemployment,drug addition,the general degeneration of law and order, with its manifestation in an increasing violent sociey and terrorism(especially in Ulster)are among the topics which they discuss with their family and friends.They also debate the prospects for world peace.On a personal level they are concerned about maintaining good health and being able to enjoy a good family life.They fear a further decline in the country's moral standards and the ultimate catastrophe _the outbreak of a nuclear war.Their hopes are for the emergence of a more peaceful and pollution free world, from its present traumas.
